newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Arcon's Galmoy mine sends first zinc shipment.
newsitem.headline: Arcon's Galmoy mine sends first zinc shipment.

text.p: Arcon International Resources Plc on Monday sent its first shipment of zinc concentrate, marking a move from development into production, for the Irish midlands-based mine.

Chief executive Tony O'Reilly Junior said 20 years had elapsed since any company has developed a commercial zinc mine in Ireland and today's announcement marked the culmination of an 85 million Irish pound project for Kilkenny-based Arcon.
On current reserve estimates, O'Reilly said the Galmoy mine has a life of about 13 years.

"We are proud that Arcon is the first Irish-owned company to develop a zinc mine which we believe will play a very significant role in the development of the industry in Ireland into the long-term future," O'Reilly said.

During the five-year period of development Arcon has undertaken a significant investment programme in the local community and more than three million Irish pounds was spent on development of infrastructure, the group said in a statement.
It said the commissioning and production schedule has been running parallel to the recruitment programme which will result in a workforce of up to 200 at Galmoy.
Arcon has already employed 90 workers and the full number of employees will be phased in over the next three months, it said.
Irish energy minister Alan Dukes visited the site which officially marked the culmination of an 85 million punt project for Arcon on Monday.
